info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:42AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Periods of light snow will impact southwest and portions of Central Montana through this afternoon... Light snow will increase over Southwest and portions of Central Montana this afternoon as a fast moving Pacific weather system moves through the region. Snowfall amounts will generally be on the light side, ranging from trace amounts to a half inch at lower elevations to an inch or two at pass level. Localized areas may receive higher amounts. The snow will end from west to east late this afternoon. Anyone traveling should be prepared for variable road conditions, including slippery roads and reduced visibility as low as a half mile at times due to falling and blowing snow.
